intro: Scleria dieterlenii, commonly known as the Dieterlen's spikerush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with slender, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny flowers, typically arranged in dense clusters. Scleria dieterlenii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streams. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
